item.title: My comp be able to play bf3 on medium settings?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Newegg is ridiculously cheap compared to what we can get in the UK, that same monitor would be £99 here (around $155).

But anyway, that looks like a solid rig, go for it Don’t expect it to run bf3 fabulously though, unless they make some optimisation for the final release.

Read full topic

item.source: My comp be able to play bf3 on medium settings?

item.title: My comp be able to play bf3 on medium settings?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:11, topic:416368”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=518292.msg3767124#msg3767124 date=1317335443]
I finished downloading the beta 3 hours ago and I must say my laptop struggles, I could run BCBF2 fine on medium, but on this, she struggles on low the specs are a lot higher than previous games, I mean crysis 2 runs better than this.
[/quote]
I really hope my laptop will do fine then. Just started the download. As my laptop gets hot (and its an Asus, it does get hot) it tends to not want to overclock as much. I guess its time to break out the AC for my laptop.[/quote]
You’ve got a GTX460M iirc? It’ll do fine , mine’s only an ATI radeon hd 5650M, tis a little behind yours, but it runs all other games nicely, just not this
On the subject of overclocking, did boost the core and memory clocks by 100 and 200 respectively and that’s boosted me another 12 frames average

Read full topic
item.source: My comp be able to play bf3 on medium settings?

item.title: My comp be able to play bf3 on medium settings?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

SilentCJ:

I finished downloading the beta 3 hours ago and I must say my laptop struggles, I could run BCBF2 fine on medium, but on this, she struggles on low the specs are a lot higher than previous games, I mean crysis 2 runs better than this.

I really hope my laptop will do fine then. Just started the download. As my laptop gets hot (and its an Asus, it does get hot) it tends to not want to overclock as much. I guess its time to break out the AC for my laptop.

Read full topic

item.title: My comp be able to play bf3 on medium settings?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Don’t get the GTS 450.

Yes the GTX460 will handle it on medium settings easy, may as well get the GTX560 though, same card new generation, but about a 30% speed increase, extra cost is worth it.
